content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for LLaMA in the huggingface doc, what type is the spaces_between_special_tokens parameter in LlamaTokenizer and what is its default value.  Please interact with https://huggingface.co/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The task requires information from the documentation, specifically about the parameter spaces_between_special_tokens in the LlamaTokenizer. To search for this, the most direct pathway is to access the "Docs" section on the Hugging Face website.
Action: Click [5]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am in the documentation section. To efficiently find information about the LlamaTokenizer parameter, I should use the documentation search box.
Action: Type [11]; LlamaTokenizer spaces_between_special_tokens
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see a navigation panel listing LlamaTokenizer and related classes. To find the details about the parameter, I should go directly to the "LlamaTokenizer" documentation.
Action: Click [37]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The correct web element, "LlamaTokenizer," is visible and clickable in the navigation panel on the right. Clicking it should lead directly to the documentation where parameter details can be found.
Action: Click [37]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page remains on the documentation navigation without further details about LlamaTokenizer revealed. I already attempted to click [37], so likely I need to scroll down to see the LlamaTokenizer content.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The documentation content for "Llama" is visible, but I need the specific parameters for "LlamaTokenizer." I should scroll down further to reveal the section describing the LlamaTokenizer class and its parameters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The section for Llama is still visible, and the class documentation for LlamaTokenizer hasn't appeared yet. I need to continue scrolling down to find the parameter documentation for LlamaTokenizer.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The documentation still displays code examples and explanations related to Llama and quantization. However, "LlamaTokenizer" is now visible in the sidebar (element [29]), indicating I am close to relevant details. I should click "LlamaTokenizer" to directly jump to its section and check for the spaces_between_special_tokens parameter.
Action: Click [29]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Although I intended to click [29] (LlamaTokenizer) previously, the display hasn't changed, meaning the click did not register or I need to scroll within the content for parameter details. The right section may not respond to clicks, so scrolling in the main window should reveal the details about LlamaTokenizer.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The right sidebar shows "LlamaTokenizer" (element [28]) and the content did not yet show its details after scrolling. Clicking "LlamaTokenizer" in the sidebar should navigate directly to the relevant documentation section for parameter information.
Action: Click [28]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have already tried clicking on "LlamaTokenizer" in the right sidebar (element [28]), but the documentation content has not changed—it still shows previous example code and not the class or parameter details. This suggests the page content might need further scrolling to show "LlamaTokenizer" details or the click action is not triggering. I should scroll down further to bring the relevant class and parameter documentation into view.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The content has now moved to a "Notes" section, but the detailed class and parameter description for LlamaTokenizer is still not visible. I am close to the relevant section, so scrolling down a bit more should reveal the LlamaTokenizer documentation and its parameters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.93
